topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Editing and Deleting Objects

body.p: An object is the basic storage entity that represents a file you store in the OpenStack Object Storage system. When you upload data to OpenStack Object Storage, the data is stored as-is (no compression or encryption) and consists of a location (container), the object's name, and any metadata consisting of key/value pairs

section.title: Edit an object in a container

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Helion Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Object Store link.
In the Object Store panel, click Containers.
Select the container in which you want to store your object.
From the More drop-down list, choose Edit.
The Edit Object dialog box is displayed.
Browse to and select the file that you want to upload.

section.title: Delete an object from a container

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Helion Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Object Store link.
In the Object Store panel, click Containers.
Select the container from which you want to delete the object.
From the More drop-down list next to an object, choose Delete Object.
The Confirm Delete Object dialog box is displayed.
